item.title: Make Git Repository Smaller
item.description: Background I’ve got a git repository that I make automated commits multiple times a day, but now the local git repository is getting bigger and bigger. I’m wondering what the easiest way would be to slim down my local repository. Is there a way to remove older commits to slim down my repository size? Solution Get the commits which you need to keep, like the master branch starting from this year,
